Should Higher Education for Women Differ?
What is the best attainable training for the physician or the lawyer, man or woman? There is no reason to believe that typhoid or scarlet fever or phthisis can be successfully treated by a woman physician in one way and by a man physician in another way. There is indeed every reason to believe that unless treated in the best way the patient may die, the sex of the doctor affecting the result less even than the sex of the patient. The question needs only to be put for us to feel irrevocably sure that there is no special woman’s way of dealing with disease.

Source: “Should the Higher Education of Women Differ from That of Men?” by M. Carey Thomas. Educational Review 21, 1901.
